rev.comment: added the words "Live CD" to the image caption
rev.diff:
Line 62: Line 62:
=== Installation ===
=== Installation ===
â
[[Image:Ubuntu 9.04 Jaunty Jackalope (LiveCD).png|thumb|Ubuntu 9.04 (live session)]]
+
[[Image:Ubuntu 9.04 Jaunty Jackalope (LiveCD).png|thumb|Ubuntu 9.04 ([[live CD]] session)]]
Installation of Ubuntu is generally performed with the [[Live CD]]. The Ubuntu OS can be run directly from the CD (albeit with a performance loss), allowing a user to "test-drive" the OS for hardware compatibility and driver support. The CD also contains the Ubiquity installer,<ref name="livecdinstall">{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/ubuntu-installation-606-2.html | title=Installing Ubuntu from the Live CD | accessdate=2008-08-19|publisher=Integrity Enterprises}}</ref> which then can guide the user through the permanent installation process. [[CD image]]s of all current and past versions are available for [http://www.ubuntu.com/GetUbuntu/download download at the Ubuntu web site]. Installing from the CD requires a minimum of 256 MB [[Random Access Memory|RAM]].
Installation of Ubuntu is generally performed with the [[Live CD]]. The Ubuntu OS can be run directly from the CD (albeit with a performance loss), allowing a user to "test-drive" the OS for hardware compatibility and driver support. The CD also contains the Ubiquity installer,<ref name="livecdinstall">{{cite web | url=http://www.easy-ubuntu-linux.com/ubuntu-installation-606-2.html | title=Installing Ubuntu from the Live CD | accessdate=2008-08-19|publisher=Integrity Enterprises}}</ref> which then can guide the user through the permanent installation process. [[CD image]]s of all current and past versions are available for [http://www.ubuntu.com/GetUbuntu/download download at the Ubuntu web site]. Installing from the CD requires a minimum of 256 MB [[Random Access Memory|RAM]].
